title: Day 3 Functions
message:
Function: a block of code we can reuse!
Why? To avoid writing code multiple times (automating processes)
What is a function made of?
1. Name
2. Parameters/arguments 
3. Function body
4. Return statement

Defining and calling a function are different -- how do we call a function?

Defining functions:

function name(parameter) {
function body
function body
return statement
}

Return statement is the value you are pulling out of the function

Calling functions: name(arguments)

**Defining a function does not run any code**

You must **call** the function for it to run.

Bad example:

function add(a, b) {
  a + b 
  }

  var total = add(1,2);

  console.log(total);
	
	(this will return undefined because the computer does not know what to do with the output.)
	
Must put the word "return" before a+b to let the computer know what to do with the values it is calculating. 
	
CONSOLE LOG IS NOT THE SAME THING AS RETURN. "CONSOLE LOG DOES NOT RETURN SHIT."
